items.description: PCA on 5 DFII daily changes (DFII5/7/10/20/30), output top 2-3 principal components as z-scores. Purely orthogonal by construction, no autocorrelation issue from rolling windows.
items.reason: Attempts 7-9 reveal irreconcilable Sharpe-MAE tradeoff with hand-crafted features. rr_slope_level_z (autocorr=0.937) helps Sharpe but hurts MAE. PCA may find a compromise linear combination. All previous attempts used hand-crafted features; PCA lets the data determine the optimal linear combination of yield curve changes.
items.caution: High probability (>60%) that attempt 10 will also fail to beat attempt 7. The Sharpe +0.329 result may be near-optimal for deterministic yield curve features.

items.description: Attempt 7's 3 change features + exponential decay weighting on slope/curvature (half-life 10-20 days instead of 252-day rolling window)
items.reason: The autocorrelation problem in rr_slope_level_z comes from the 252-day rolling window. Exponential decay with short half-life captures rate dynamics without the persistence artifact that causes MAE degradation.

previous_feedback.root_cause: Combination strategy failed. Adding rr_slope_level_z back (attempt 7 feature) + 5th interaction feature did NOT combine Sharpe and MAE strengths. Instead produced worst of both: Sharpe -0.186 (worse than attempt 8 -0.260), MAE -0.0141 (worse than attempt 8 -0.0203), DA -0.0173 (worst of 7/8/9).
key_evidence: Attempt 9 STRICTLY WORSE than attempt 8 on ALL metrics
0/3 folds improved DA, 0/3 improved Sharpe (1/3 improved trivially due to negative base)
5 features introduced more noise than 3 features (attempt 8) or 4 features (attempt 7)
Interaction feature (slope_diff * curvature_diff z-score) contributed negligible information

cross_attempt_analysis.attempt_7: Sharpe +0.329 (BEST), MAE -0.0022, DA -0.00149. 4 features including rr_slope_level_z.
cross_attempt_analysis.attempt_8: Sharpe -0.260, MAE -0.0203 (BEST), DA -0.01471. 3 features without rr_slope_level_z.
cross_attempt_analysis.attempt_9: Sharpe -0.186, MAE -0.0141, DA -0.0173. 5 features. WORST of all three.

previous_feedback.fundamental_tradeoff: rr_slope_level_z (252-day rolling z-score, autocorr=0.937) is the key variable. With it: Sharpe improves, MAE/DA degrade. Without it: MAE improves, Sharpe degrades. Adding more features on top makes everything worse.
anti_patterns: DO NOT add features on top of attempt 7 set (attempt 9 proved this counterproductive)
DO NOT use rr_slope_level_z and expect MAE improvement (structural tradeoff)
DO NOT remove rr_slope_level_z and expect Sharpe improvement (structural tradeoff)
what_to_try: Completely different feature extraction: PCA on daily changes (data-driven, not hand-crafted)
Different time scale: exponential decay instead of 252-day rolling window
Accept that attempt 7 may be near-optimal and focus on confirming this
